title: Giants coach Tom Coughlin offers update on status of wide receiver Victor Cruz
text:
Comments 
EAST RUTHERFORD â€” Wide receiver Victor Cruz , who has missed all five games this season, has not been cleared to return to the practice field, Giants coach Tom Coughlin said Wednesday during a teleconference with Philadelphia-area reporters. 
"He's rehabbing, working indoors primarily, working with the trainers," Coughlin told Eagles beat writers in advance of Monday night's NFC East showdown. "He's in every meeting. However, he has not been cleared to begin on the field." 
Cruz apparently will not make a storybook return against the Eagles at Lincoln Financial Field, a year after he suffered a torn right patellar tendon . 
PLUS : Odell Beckham Jr. optimistic he will play vs. Eagles, source says 
Cruz was expected to make his season debut against the Bills on Oct. 4 in Buffalo - he told reporters the Monday before the game he was "convinced" he would be able to play - but on his first day back at practice, he reinjured the calf and left the field after just a handful of reps. He has not run on ground since. Cruz initially injured the calf on Aug. 17. 
Cruz has not played in a game since he suffered his season-ending injury against the Eagles. 
After he reinjured the calf, Cruz had a PRP injection in the muscle to try to speed up the recovery process. Cruz was scheduled to meet with doctors this past Monday , 10 days after the injection, to re-evaluate the injury. 
The Giants have been off Tuesday and Wednesday, and Coughlin had no update on the examination when asked Monday by New York-area reporters on a conference call.
